unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand contemporary approaches to teaching and learning, especially as they relate to Society and Culture.

Appreciate the importance of placing the Society and Culture curriculum within a contemporary context and the capacity to implement learning experiences that use a variety of contemporary resources to promote cross-disciplinary conceptual understanding.
Plan and implement learning experiences that emphasise a social inquiry approach to learning.
Recognise that the social and cultural diversity of students is a valuable educational resource in the context of the Society and Culture classroom.
Plan learning experiences that cater for the diversity of learners within the Society and Culture classroom.
Understand the assessment and reporting requirements of Society and Culture, especially as they relate to management and monitoring of students' Personal Interest Projects.
Have a working knowledge and understanding of the structure, content and philosophy of the Years 11-12 Society and Culture Syllabus.
Build student rapport and foster a supporting learning environment in a subject area highly dependent on discussion and the exchange of social and cultural perspectives and knowledge.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Workshop preparation may include completing set readings, conducting research, or, compiling resources

assessments.assessment_title: Development and rationale for the personal Interest Project (PIP)
assessments.description: Students will develop a proposal for a Personal Interest Project. The proposal includes a Rationale; Research Methods; Justification; and, an Annotated Bibliography (2000 words)

assessments.assessment_title: Supporting Student’s Development of their PIP
assessments.description: This assessment consists of TWO parts related to scaffolding student's development of the PIP. Part 1 covers Focus Question Development for sample students. Part 2 is a pedagogical reflection drawing on recent pedagogical and other scholarly literature. (2000 words)

data.subject_search_title: EDTE4400 - Society and Culture in the Secondary School I
data.description: This unit is designed for students who plan to teach Society and Culture for years 11 and 12 but whose major teaching subject is in another area, such as Geography or History. The unit explores the aims, content and instructional demands of the NESA Society and Culture syllabus documents for Stage 6, and assists students to design innovative, student-centered units of work and to identify or develop appropriate teaching resources.
